borough: London Borough of Barking and Dagenham
decision_conditions: <p style="">The proposed new dwellinghouse&nbsp;fails to deliver an acceptable quantum of&nbsp;private, useable, accessible and safe external amenity area.&nbsp;As such, the proposed development represents sub-standard accommodation that will not facilitate an acceptable living standard for future occupiers.&nbsp; The proposed development is therefore contrary to:</p><ul><li class="MsoNormal">Paragraph 130 of the National Planning Policy Framework (DLUHC, September 2023)</li><li class="MsoNormal">Policy D6 of the London Plan (March 2021)</li><li class="MsoNormal">Policy CP3 of the LDF Core Strategy (July 2010)</li><li class="MsoNormal">Policy BP5 of the LDF Borough Wide Development Plan Policies DPD (March 2011)</li><li class="MsoNormal">Policies SP2&nbsp;and DMD 1 of the LBBD Draft Local Plan 2037 (Regulation 19 Submission version, December 2021)</li><li class="MsoNormal">DCLG Technical Housing Standards (nationally described space standard) (DCLG, March 2015) (as amended)</li></ul>

<p style=""><span pt="" sans="" style="">By reason of the cumulative impact of the additions to the host dwellinghouse, the addition of a new dwelling, and the resulting discordant roofscape, the development adds</span>&nbsp;excessive&nbsp;bulk and massing to the site, failing to retain the original character of the host&nbsp;dwellinghouse by&nbsp;distracting from its original characteristic proportions and features.&nbsp;The proposed dwellinghouse closes the existing openness of the corner,&nbsp;and&nbsp;disrupts the host terrace's form and design, whilst also disrupting the established surrounding building lines, symmetry and built form which are positive features of the streetscene. This impact is notable&nbsp;given the location of the application site within the Becontree Estate. As such, the proposed development is contrary to:</p><div><ul><li><span pt="" sans="">Paragraph 130 of the National Planning Policy Framework</span>&nbsp;(NPPF) (DLUHC, September 2023)</li><li class="MsoNormal">Policies&nbsp;D4 and HC1 of the London Plan (March 2021)</li><li><span pt="" sans="">Policies CP2 and CP3 of the&nbsp;</span>Local Development Framework (LDF) Core Strategy (July 2010)</li><li><span pt="" sans="">Policies BP2 and BP11 of the&nbsp;</span>Local Development Framework (LDF) Borough Wide Development Plan Document (DPD) (March 2011)</li><li><span pt="" sans="">Policies SP2, DMD1, DMD4 and DMD6 of </span>LBBD Draft Local Plan 2037 (Regulation 19 Submission version, December 2021)</li><li>Paragraphs 5.1, 5.4, 5.4.4 of the Residential Extensions and Alterations Supplementary Planning Document (February 2012)</li></ul></div>

<p style="">The application has failed to demonstrate that the proposed development would&nbsp;<span style="line-height: 16.8667px;"><span arial="">accommodate appropriate off-street car parking provision, or that there is sufficient on-street car parking capacity</span>. As such, it cannot be ensured that the development will&nbsp;</span><span style="line-height: 16.8667px;">not negatively impact the highway and existing residents and users of the surrounding area. The application is therefore&nbsp;</span>contrary to:</p><div><ul><li><span pt="" sans="">Paragraph 110 of the&nbsp;</span>National Planning Policy Framework (NPPF) (DLUHC, September 2023)</li><li>Policy T6.1 of the London Plan (March 2021);</li><li><span pt="" sans="">Policies BR9 and BR10 of the&nbsp;</span>Local Development Framework (LDF) Borough Wide Development Plan Document (DPD) (March 2011)</li><li><span pt="" sans="" style="">Policy DMT2 of&nbsp;</span>the LBBD Draft Local Plan 2037 (Regulation 19 Submission version, December 2021)</li></ul></div>
description: Construction of a single storey front and rear extension to the existing dwelling and the Construction of a new two storey 2x bedroom dwellinghouse adjacent to 331 Sheppey Road

constraints_details.result: 331 Sheppey Road, Dagenham, Barking And Dagenham, RM9 4JU
